p: Mycoprotein is a protein rich product obtained from the mycelium produced by the growth of the fungus Fusarium venenatum during fermentation, which can be processed for human consumption. Mycoprotein is mixed with a small quantity of egg albumen, some roasted barley malt extract and water or a natural flavoring is mixed in instead of malt to give a savory character [ 28]. The filamentous structure of mycoprotein is what gives this product the meat-like texture.
